results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: Including girls: an overview of gender inclusive curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.brief_description: Disusses the disatvantages faced by girls at school and suggests how teachers can benefit all students by improving the classroom learning environment.

results.title: Lease of life
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Presents the Victorian Cancer Institute’s 4MeV linear accelerator. An important weapon against cancer, it is used for deep X-ray therapy. Traces a case history of a woman who is eventually restored to her family by the special treatment made possible by the accelerator. Narrated by Marcia Hart. Filmed at the Peter MacCallum Cancer Institute in Melbourne, Victoria.

results.title: Grapes are growing
results.creator_credit: Peter Menzies, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australia’s wine industry. Shows the factors leading to high quality grapes; the process of wine making in which grapes are tested, weighed, transported, crushed, fermented, stored and bottled ready for use. Includes the traditional method of making ‘champagne’ and the importance of the Australian Wine Research Institute and Roseworthy College.

results.title: The Dandenong Story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: Dandenong, Victoria, named after an Aboriginal tribe, is a fast growing town. As the gateway to Gippsland and the Latrobe Valley, it is important for agriculture. But even more significant is the development of big industrial plants manufacturing goods such as carpets, trucks, cars and fruit cans. Such decentralization of industry is bringing prosperity and a high standard of living to Dandenong and Australia as a whole.
